sagex.phoenix.vfs.filters

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.factory.BaseConfigurable
      • sagex.phoenix.vfs.filters.Filter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ConfigurableOption>, IConfigurable, HasLabel, HasName, PublicCloneable, IResourceFilter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlbumStartsWithFilter, ArtistStartsWithFilter, BaseRegexFilter, BDFilter, ChannelFilter, CurrentlyRecordingFilter, DateFilter, DontLikeFilter, DVDFilter, EpisodeTitleStartsWithFilter, FavoriteFilter, FirstRunFilter, GenresFilter, GenreStartsWithFilter, GlobalExcludeFilter, HDFilter, HomeVideosFilter, ManualRecordingFilter, MediaResourceTypeFilter, MediaTypeFilter, MetadataFieldFilter, MissingTVFilter, PartiallyWatchedFilter, PQLFilter, RatingsFilter, RecentlyWatchedFilter, ReRunFilter, TitleStartsWithFilter, UserCategoryFilter, WatchedFilter, WrappedResourceFilter

    public abstract class Filter
extends BaseConfigurable
implements IResourceFilter, java.lang.Cloneable, HasName, HasLabel
    Filters are used to restrict a view based on a criteria. Subclasses must implement the canAccept() method, and define their configurable options in the constructor. You must call super() from the constructor to ensure that the base filter options get added.

    Subclasses must also extend the clone method, if they have objects that require deep cloning.

      • onUpdate

        protected void onUpdate()
        Subclasses can override this method to udpate thier local states when options change. This will only be called at the time that accept() method is called.
